name: DoubleTree by Hilton Memphis Downtown

reviews.title: Could be my new "go-to" hotel in Memphis
reviews.text: I usually stay at the Embassy Suite on Shady Grove in East Memphis for business. I opted for the Doubletree downtown because the rate was lower. I enjoyed the pool for an hour inbetween meetings and loved it! The staff was helpful and pleasant. My breakfast was really good too. It is conveniently located downtown to all my clients in the area.

Hi i travelled with my wife & mum & dad to Memphis as my mum & dad are big Elvis fans, sorry i have taken so long in putting my review (8 months in fact) but i have been busy, anyway i promised them i would take them to Memphis for the Elvis experience, we had a long flight travelling from the UK around 10 hours with connection, anyway i booked this hotel with Expedia & saved quite a lot of money too doing it that way as a group, we got to the hotel after a very long flight & was met at the front door by the concierge who took our luggage & we booked in & the reception area & lobby was fantastic, we got adjoining rooms which was great as my mum & dad don't like being to far away from me, the rooms were very basic with 2 double beds in each room, a TV & coffee machine, the hotel had a swimming pool but it was closed as it was out of season when we stayed, the hotel is a couple of blocks away from Beale Street which was good as we probably went down there every night & listened to all different kinds of music, the hotel lifts were made of glass so you could see the lobby floor getting further away from you we were on the 4th floor & my mum didn't like that too much as she doesn't really like heights. There was a TGI Fridays built on the side of the Doubletree hotel we did eat in there a few times & the staff got to know us & we had a good laugh & joke with them all, the staff at the hotel were very nice & the hotel itself was very clean, but the carpets in the hallways do really need changing as they were old & worn, but we really enjoyed our stay in this hotel & would not hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Would stay here again........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location was downtown but had to pay extra $ for parking. Staff was nice, even the maid who ended up stealing my jewelry out of my luggage while we were out sightseeing. The room was okay: peeling wall paper, broken shower head and burnt out light bulbs. Our room key never worked. Even after waiting in our room for maintenance to replace the entire keyless mechanism.
reviews.title: STAY ANYWHERE BUT HERE!

reviews.text: Do Not Leave Any Valuables In Your Room!! My ring that had belonged to my sister (who passed away 2 years ago) is gone. It was not valuable but had great sentimental value. When I think of Memphis & The Doubletree I get a sick feeling in my stomach. Beware!
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.text: Please see my blog at http://talesfromtheroad-mwalno.blogspot.com/
reviews.title: Allowed us to see sights, but would not stay again

reviews.text: We stayed one night over the 4th of July weekend. Neat lobby! Rooms were clean and well furnished/updated. TGIFriday's in lobby nice to have but don't get too excited about breakfast buffet. Staff was nice and pool was good for us although small. Be great place if going to ballgame as stadium right across street. Only negative I would mention: parking. Large hotel has a parking area about the size of 2 car garage. Staff works very hard to make it work but offsite parking can be a hassle. Would stay there again for sure.
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.text: The Doubletree, like any of the hotels near Beale St,, is really facing an uphill battle. Somehow it has to stay in reasonable shape despite being overrun by people who largely stay in the hotel to access the canned revelry on Beale. The Doubletree is losing the battle.
reviews.title: Getting Rundown But Good Location

reviews.text: The hallways were dingy with threadbare carpet. Even the nonsmoking floors had a smell of cigarettes about them. Don't expect much from the rooftop pool. No extra towels, not enough chair and lounges for more than 7 or 8 people. It's just a blank concrete space with a narrow, shallow pool. How about some potted plants?
reviews.title: Exceptional Service

reviews.text: The rooms are decorated in an attempt to be hip and urbane but it all just falls flat because this version of hip and urbane is from 1992. Lots of yellows, oranges, stripes, other bright colors.
reviews.title: Nice common area, rooms need upgrading

reviews.text: On the upside, it's close to Autozone Park which is a good place to catch a AAA baseball game and it's steps to Beale St. without being close enough that you ar bothered by the noise when you want to go to sleep. There is a Friday's attached to the lobby...maybe that says it all.
reviews.title: Should Have Thought about the Reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is undergoing construction, and because of this, the concierege was very accomodating and gave my husband and me complimentary breakfast vouchers. The main problem I had with the hotel was the valet situation. It would take 20 mins just to find someone to take our valet ticket and then literally 45 minutes for someone to bring us our car. The third time that we needed our car, we asked the front desk if we could just walk and get it ourselves (to save us an hour!). The front desk informed us that 'it was not allowed'... so once again, we stood around for up to an hour waiting for our car. I have never seen anything like it! Our whole experience would have been wonderful had it not been for the valet service which, per the front desk, is mandatory.
reviews.title: Great hotel, Service not so great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This property is in the process of renovations, which I can totally appreciate, however their service leaved less to be desired. The construction workers worked outside of the room a little too early for our liking and the front desk staff needed to be pushed to help us out with questions. The room was comfy, with a great bed, but there was construction dust in places and a few messy paint spots. Assuming they finish their renovations I’d give them one more shot and stay again. Two block walk to Beale Street is a great bonus.
reviews.title: They have some work to do

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is undergoing some renovations, so our floor smelled like fresh paint. Our room had mildew on the ceiling in the bathroom and rips in the window treatments---and our room was one of the renovated rooms. The hotel is, however, very conveniently located to Beale St, Peabody Place, Fed-Ex Forum, etc. The bedding was very comfortable, and all the staff we encountered were very pleasant & helpful.
reviews.title: Less than thrilling experience

reviews.text: Suggestions: More than 4 lounge chairs are needed by the pool. Fix all the broken ice machines (2 & 3 floors). Patch the holes in the ceilings from the old window treatments in the rooms.
reviews.title: Pluses and minuses..

reviews.text: This hotel is not on Beale St so it is quiet. Beds are nice and comfortable. Rooms I've stayed in could use an update and more lighting. Room 515 seemed to have some mold issues or something going on in the shower only. There was a bathtub/shower then a separate shower - which was nice - but I wouldn't use the shower only option b/c it smelled moldy/mildewy. Above that shower area was a noticeable water damaged area on the ceiling. This seems to be a very old property and although it has been renovated, it just still has a 'needs to be updated' feel to it. During this last stay, they WERE renovating the interiors outside the rooms. I hope they update the rooms as well. Give me more lighting options in the room!! :) Staff was friendly and helpful and my co-worker and I stay their on almost every trip to Memphis. There are pluses and minuses to this hotel but overall it is fine. The comfy beds are certainly a plus :)
reviews.title: very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: boyfriend & i stayed here for 2 nights/3 days this past weekend.
reviews.title: PERFECT!

reviews.text: did not have a rental car so am unable to review their valet service.
reviews.title: Good Location but hotel barely average

reviews.text: however, the service elsewhere we recieved was amazing.
reviews.title: Good Location, Horrible Service

reviews.text: impeccable bed/ bath rooms..
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel Experience

reviews.text: & the daily housekeeping did a great job.
reviews.title: Great people serving you in a Great location!

aka: Doubletree By Hilton Memphis Downtown Hotel
description: Situated in the heart of Downtown Memphis entertainment district. DoubleTree by Hilton Memphis Downtown has the harmonious blending of modern and historic styles and offers guests the comforts of home as well as the excitement of the Memphis Downtown scene.
